info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 5:02PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 455 PM EDT, local law enforcement and public indicate that numerous roads across Downtown Charleston and West Ashley remain closed or impassible due to flooding. At 445 PM, the stage on Church Creek near West Ashley was 6.17 ft, flood stage in 5.5 ft. At 5.5 ft, Church Creek will flood portions of Winners Circle and water will approach Crosstowne Church. This flooding resulted from 5 to 8 inches of rain that fell with the passage of Hurricane Ian. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Hanahan, Downtown Charleston, West Ashley, James Island, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Fort Sumter, Daniel Island, Johns Island, Hollywood, Isle Of Palms, Folly Beach, Ravenel, Sullivan`s Island, Charles Towne Landing, Maybank Bridge, James Island County Park and Charleston Naval Complex.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
